Package org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.services

Class AbstractService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.services.AbstractService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Engine
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractEventReaderService, AbstractEventWriterService, AbstractStreamSourceService
    public abstract class AbstractService
extends java.lang.Object
implements Engine
    An base class for service engines that obtains the service information from a YAML file. This service specification file should be a resource named as the concrete service class.

    • Method Detail

      • executeGroup

        public EngineData executeGroup​(java.util.Set<EngineData> inputs)
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Executes the engine with the given set of input data.

        This method can be executed concurrently in several threads.

        Specified by:
        executeGroup in interface Engine
        Parameters:
        inputs - the data set to execute the engine with
        Returns:
        the result and/or status of the execution request, it cannot be null or without data (unless it is an error status), and it should not be the same as one of the input data references

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the engine.
        Returns:
        the engine name

      • getStates

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getStates()
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Gets the set of possible states for the engine results. States should be set as the result of processing a request and stored in the result data. Orchestrators and clients of the engine can use the states as part of an application composition to provide advanced routing of the execution outputs.
        Specified by:
        getStates in interface Engine
        Returns:
        a set with the possible states for the engine results, it can be null or empty if the engine doesn't uses states

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Gets a description of the engine.

        A good description should provide an initial summary sentence about the engine, a section with complete details of what the engine does, how to configure the service and the supported data types, all the requests that the engine can handle, with the expected input types and values and the resulting output types and values, the returned errors for failed requests, and a changelog for the current version.

        Specified by:
        getDescription in interface Engine
        Returns:
        a string with the description

      • getVersion

        public java.lang.String getVersion()
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Gets the version of the engine. Examples are: a semver release number, a git describe output, an alpha or beta testing release, etc.
        Specified by:
        getVersion in interface Engine
        Returns:
        a version string

      • getAuthor

        public java.lang.String getAuthor()
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Gets the author(s) of the engine. Authors are responsible of developing and maintaining a service engine.

        This information should provide at least a name and a contact email.

        Specified by:
        getAuthor in interface Engine
        Returns:
        an string listing the author(s) of the engine.
